avalancheActivity.highlights: Intense snowfall is expected in E-winds on Thursday that could drift and form wind slabs in W-facing hills. The new snow could be unstable to begin with.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow melted away widely in the warming episode last week. Some snow remains however in certain places in the mountains but that snow has gotten stiff and stable after freezing started again. The snowpack is therefore likely homogenous and strong. Short but intense snowfall is expected on Thursday in strong E-winds. Binding with the older snow will likely be weak to begin with and western facing hills could be especially dangerous as wind slabs could form.

travelAdvisory.comment: Windslabs have formed widely in southern facing hills in the north and east of the country after the storm on Tuesday and the snowpack is currently considered unstable. Intense but short burst of snowfall is expected in E-winds on Thursday in the SW corner and the snow could be unstable to begin with.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Windslabs have formed in the N and E after the storm on Tuesday. Persistent weak layers could have developed in the cold weather. Windslabs could also be present in the SW after snowfall in E-winds.

weatherForecast.highlights: Spáð er hvassri A-átt 10-12 m/sek með ákafri snjókomu aðfaranótt fimmtudags. Lægir síðan með föstudeginum áður en annar bakki af snjókomu gengur yfir svæðið í SA hvassviðri. Frost gæti náð allt að -20 gráðum til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Little snow is in the area but new snow is on top of older snow, which is stiff and considered stable. Small windslabs could form on SW-W aspects in the next few days.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Little snow is in the area. Snowfall is predicted the night before Tuesday, which could form windslabs on SW-W aspects and be unstable to begin with, but these slabs will most likely be small. The older snow is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Windslabs have formed widely in southern facing hills in the north and east of the country after the storm on Tuesday and the snowpack is currently considered unstable. Intense but short burst of snowfall is expected in E-winds on Thursday in the SW corner and the snow could be unstable to begin with.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Windslabs have formed in the N and E after the storm on Tuesday. Persistent weak layers could have developed in the cold weather. Windslabs could also be present in the SW after snowfall in E-winds.

weatherForecast.highlights: N-A 8-15 m/s og snjókoma aðfaranótt fimmtudags. Hægari A-SA átt á föstudag og úrkomulítið. Hvessir aftur á laugardag. Kalt í veðri en hlýnar örlítið á laugardag.

avalancheActivity.comment: 3 wet avalanches fell in Héðinsfjörður likely in the warm episode of last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow fell on Tuesday in strong N-winds. Snow formed wind-slabs in S-facing hills and the new snow will likely be unstable the first days after the storm. Little snowfall will continue throughout the week in N-winds.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It snowed in strong N-winds throughout Tuesday and wind slabs formed in S-facing hills, the new snow is likely unstable to begin with. The older snow has been through melt-freeze cycles and is widely considered stable. However, the warming episode from last week likely had less impact high in the mountains were some faceting could have occured in the snowpack after it frooze again. Minor snowfall will continue throughout the week.

travelAdvisory.comment: Windslabs have formed widely in southern facing hills in the north and east of the country after the storm on Tuesday and the snowpack is currently considered unstable. Intense but short burst of snowfall is expected in E-winds on Thursday in the SW corner and the snow could be unstable to begin with.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Windslabs have formed in the N and E after the storm on Tuesday. Persistent weak layers could have developed in the cold weather. Windslabs could also be present in the SW after snowfall in E-winds.

weatherForecast.highlights: Lítilsháttar snjókoma heldur áfram út vikuna en dregur úr ákefð og vind lægir. Hitastig gæti farið í -20 upp til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow is in the area. It has likely formed windslabs on most aspects which could be unstable to begin with.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow arrived on Tuesday and Wednesday during strong northerly winds. The new snow has most likely formed windslabs on most aspects, but least of all on northwesterly aspects, which could be unstable to begin with. Larger windslabs are more likely at higher elevations. Isolated weak layers could still be present in older snow, which could become weaker during the cold weather. The bond between layers is unknown.

travelAdvisory.comment: Windslabs have formed widely in southern facing hills in the north and east of the country after the storm on Tuesday and the snowpack is currently considered unstable. Intense but short burst of snowfall is expected in E-winds on Thursday in the SW corner and the snow could be unstable to begin with.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Windslabs have formed in the N and E after the storm on Tuesday. Persistent weak layers could have developed in the cold weather. Windslabs could also be present in the SW after snowfall in E-winds.

weatherForecast.highlights: Dregur úr vindi á fimmtudag, NV/V 8-13 m/s og úrkomulítið. Lægir enn frekar á föstudag en snýst í austlæga átt um kvöldið. Á laugardag er útlit fyrir SA/A-læga átt með snjókomu. Áfram kalt í veðri en hlýnar á laugardag.
